Text: Death blooms in a raging tempest!
Come forth, dear friends, and beguile mine enemies!
Solitary leaves, I call upon you─fly at the mercy of the storm!
Reeds of the earth, take to the skies!
From accursed boughs do wicked buds bloom!
Under normal circumstances, I would find this ninjutsu endearing... Would that her petals did not seek to do us harm!
The blossoms must be enchanted. Keep a watchful eye on how they fly, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>!
I should like to pat their fluffy little heads, but a well-trained pup will go to great lengths to protect its master...
Face me, and I shall grant you an honorable death!
My blade thirsts for mortal blood!
To me, my warriors! Your lord has need of you!
That my blade could miss its mark... You are a formidable foe.
In tenebrous night shall you meet your end...
In gardens of flame do true warriors thrive!
War is a sea of sorrow, and you shall drown!
My blade is inescapable!
My ire is an infernal flame, never to be smothered!
Our spirits are as the wind, never to be fettered!
To arms, my warriors! We make for the front lines!
I once dreamed of shaking hands with a giant oni, but not like this!
They may have strength in numbers, but worry not! If you cannot beat them, dodge them, I say!
Thank the kami the winds have ceased... We should make for shelter ere we are blown back to the foot of the mountain!
If I had to wager a guess, these must be the temple's stores. Rather spacious, aren't they?
Were I a treasure─cursed or no─I imagine I would abide within these walls. But where...
Under the auspices of two auspices, as it were. Curious.
So the glass serves as a magicked doorknob of sorts? The monks were certainly inventive...
You too are a connoisseur of Far Eastern maps, I trust? Terribly charming, how the Four Lords are shown ruling the cardinal directions.
I might have known that Suzaku and Seiryu were the guardians of this gateway─though in fairness, one usually needs grapple with only one at a time.
...Would that we had arrived sooner. Judging by her supernatural size, the demons have already taken that poor shinobi.
She must be in the thrall of a treasure. A promising lead...though at an unfortunate cost.
I see no clockwork mechanisms... We've an honest-to-kami mononoke on our hands.
The bloodlust is palpable... Have care, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! I shall be right here─at a reasonably safe distance─cheering you on!
Excellent work, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! I knew from the first you would emerge victori─
...What, pray tell, is that look for?
Your faith in my faith in you aside, you may be interested to know that I recognize the detailing on this armor. It once belonged to a renowned warrior.
Would that my falcon had the freight capacity of a barge...
Alas, I suppose I must choose which artifacts to leave behind─for now.
Well done, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Even the fiercest mononoke is no match for you!
'Tis difficult to appreciate while under threat of slicing and dicing, but the monks amassed a truly impressive collection of blades here.
To say naught of our most enspirited armor!
Perhaps the soul of the warrior who once wore it yet lingered, awaiting his chance to take to the battlefield once more...
Or perhaps his sword was a treasure with a life of its own.
A vexing conundrum─what to bring back to Kugane, that is. I don't suppose you've space in your bag...?
Well done, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! You are an unholy terror on the battlefield─and I mean that in the most flattering way.
To think that our secret passage would lead us to such an immaculate armory... Perhaps the monks utilized this as a shelter in times of strife.
I doubt they expected the armor they stored to come to life, however. Quite the harrowing foe, that one.
...Which leads me to believe that the armor itself must be one of the treasures we seek!
Despite its storied history, it looks almost pristine. I suspect the monks tended to it regularly.

It shall prove quite the challenge to bring back...but I daresay my falcon and I are up to the task! Pray accept my unending gratitude for your assistance, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>.
A clash for the ages! Life-threatening circumstances aside, 'tis always a pleasure to witness bushido at work.
I had guessed the passage we traversed would lead us to the stores' most valuable contents─lo and behold!
Such exceptional relics are a rarity indeed...this armor not least of all.
The spirit that enlivened it may have been one of the very tsukumogami of rumor.
In an ideal world, I would not hesitate to bring home every last blade the mononoke touched... Alas, my falcon can only bear so much weight.
This calls for serious consideration... Pray leave me to my thoughts for a moment.
How pleasingly picturesque! Had we no demons to slay, I would suggest a more leisurely stroll.
I shudder to think of the chaos should those creatures find their way to civilization...
I suppose we're obliged to take the scenic route.
That ahead is Shojo Temple, home to Gorai and his accursed collection!
If only we had time for the typical ablutions... But a proper pilgrimage must wait for another day.
For now, treasure awaits! As do the monk and his minions, of course. Do have care.
I admit that I was equally tempted to pull that rope, though part of me wishes you hadn't...
The statues keep silent vigil in their masters' absence...but they are not the treasures we seek. Onward!
The temple stretches on ever further. Step lively, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! We've plenty to explore.
Even the inner sanctum is plagued with demons. If any who remained did survive, 'twould be nothing short of a miracle.
Splendid as these statues are, they appear lacking in the “accursed” aspect. Our quarry must lie further in.
Though the temple's isolation is a blessing for the smallfolk, I imagine it made the monks' experience all the more harrowing...
We have yet to see hide nor hair of Gorai...
Breathtaking! 'Tis as though the majestic tiger it depicts might pounce off the screen at any─ Oh?
That was not an invitation! Your assistance, please, ObjectParameter(1), ,1)>!
That precarious pile of crates is a mountain unto itself!
Somehow, I doubt that brute has learned its lesson... But let us continue on.
By the kami, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>, how did you get up there?
Adventurers and their climbing... Why, just the other day, on Kugane Tower─ But perhaps that is a tale for another time.
That sounded promising... If you suddenly hear my winsome wailing, you had best come running!
Ah, a secret stairwell! How very convenient.
Both master and minion, irascible to the last...
Tokimori's words ring true. These creatures allow for not a modicum of mercy.
With your victory, we may now free the mountain of Gorai's influence─by liberating these treasures from his collection, of course.
Any one of them may have harbored spiritual forces. Perhaps all of them─it would certainly explain Gorai's impressive transformation.
As for which deserves a place in my collection... Gorai's biwa, of course! A fine addition.
And with that, we may be on our way. Your company has been a pleasure as always, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>.
And so the demon is slain!
Though his avarice availed him curious tools, your skill carried the day.
One wonders what artifacts he might have unveiled had you waited a touch longer to deal the killing blow...but there's naught to be done about it now.
Naught but to take the lesson of his life to heart, perhaps. Never shirk the proper appraisal of items with dubious histories!
Bearing this firmly in mind, I shall help myself to that hammer of his.
'Twas an honor and a privilege to accompany you, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Shall we begin our preparations for the journey back?
Admirable as always, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Few would be so keen to face down a rat of that size.
To say naught of his unusual sousing. When the unholy draught touched his lips, I feared his fury would consume the entire temple.
I should like to know precisely what baleful influence was wrought upon the drink...but not enough to test it myself.
Nay, I must bring back a less volatile artifact of our endeavors...
The living lanterns─chochin, as the Hingans say─were particularly fascinating, were they not?
Now that they are returned to their original form, I may safely seek to learn more of the spirits they once harbored. Let us add them to my collection forthwith!
Curious... This lantern shines differently than the rest. The mononoke's influence, perhaps?
No, some other mechanism. What if I...
Lesson learned, Hancock─do not prod eerily glowing objects!
In any case, the monks went to great pains to conceal this path. What could have warranted such secrecy?
Kami forfend! We could suffocate under this wicked haze...
I'd wager the tsukumogami is the pipe itself─its body a mere illusion.
A brilliant display! With the demonic smoke dispelled, we may breathe easy once more.
Only an entity of great power could transform its surrounds so dramatically. You did well to outmaneuver it.
Now, I espied something resting within the shrine earlier...
I have seen depictions of this pipe before. There can be no doubt that it is an age-old treasure.
Gorai must have known that a fierce tsukumogami slumbered within it. Thus he stored it apart, far from the sanctity of the temple...
But its will was too strong to be consigned to such ignominy, and in its neglect, its power only grew. Until it was strong enough to enshroud the mount entire...
Now that this lord among demons is slain, we can assume that peace shall return to the region. We must report the good news to Mistress Tsubaki posthaste!
I─and my growing collection─should not have fared half so well without you here. I am in your debt!
Shrink before my might! Quiver in awe!
A path straight up the holy mount, is it? How refreshingly dangerous!
Why, these hills stretch on for malms! Would that they were not alive with the sound of demons.
The Hingans call these clay figures “dogu”─but why is one here, of all places?
Best to let sleeping dogu lie. For all we know, it could be cursed.
If that dogu turns on us, its extermination shall be your responsibility, I hope you know!
Fallen leaves and fresh greenery in such close proximity? 'Tis passing strange.
There are few things more breathtaking than autumnal leaves...even if they are out of season. The influence of a treasure, I suspect.
I understand you adventurers enjoy the roads less traveled, but─ And there <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> goes. Courage, Hancock!
Such a tranquil place, these mountain heights. By the look of it, I presume it is not a path that many tread.
Hmm... 'Tis not the first of those stones we've encountered. Do they serve as shrines of some sort?
No shrine is built without purpose...or so I have heard. If such is the case, then what might this one be for?
Oho! I knew from the first that the dogu was meant for something greater.
I, for one, have naught but respect for our new clay comrade! ...Do you think it can hear us?
The warding talismans on this boulder give me pause...but it shall serve as well as any bridge, I suppose.
One cannot go wrong with a rustic log bridge─assuming the trunk is free of angry spirits, of course...
Gods be good! I know not how, but the statue has awakened...and it did not wake on the right side of the proverbial bed!
Just a moment─I have read of this before! If I am not mistaken, that mononoke is Shishio, king among nue!
Even a king of beasts is no match for you, I see! Well done, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>.
The most, in a word, vivid Shishio myth tells of its ravenous rampage across the countryside. It had quite the appetite for mortal flesh!
'Tis also said that its harrowing cry is a harbinger of misfortune, but I say we should consider ourselves lucky to have chanced upon a living legend.
As for what freed it of its lithic bonds... Perhaps the revelry of its fellow mononoke roused its fighting spirit.
Alas, the beast held no treasures of Gorai's, but fret not─I shall make do with what we have here and claim a suitable souvenir.
Though our hike was fraught with peril, 'twas exhilarating in equal measure! You have my thanks, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>.
A deed fit for legend! Quite literally, for Shishio appears in countless Hingan myths.
One, in fact, tells of a wayfaring warrior who triumphed over it long ago.
As such, I was aware that its harrowing cry could warp the very earth...but to see it firsthand is a wholly different beast, I'm sure you agree.
Though the creature bore none of Gorai's treasures, we can take comfort in the knowledge that it will terrorize Lord Uzumibi's people no more.
...And in the no less valuable artifacts we've spotted over the course of our journey to the summit, naturally.
All that remains is to carry the spoils to our waiting falcons. I trust I can count on you?
That is one mononoke felled─though if the legends are to be believed, Shishio is a wholly different beast than its tsukumogami brethren.
It came to the mountain long before Gorai's time─was sealed here by the very founder of Shojo Temple, in fact.
'Tis enough to make one wonder if that boulder we felled did not possess some greater significance...
But let us turn from that dark path, and instead appreciate the sacred scenery before us! Breathtaking, is it not?
...Do let me know if you spy any artifacts of value. I should like something to commemorate this trek.
You, of course, must have my sincerest thanks for making the perilous climb!
A harrowing display! Such ferocity have I rarely seen!
And Shishio was quite fearsome as well. It puts me in the mind of the Western chimera.
Yet of all that I have seen today, I am most taken with the dogu. I admit, I had my doubts...but to restore life to nature is no common feat.
I should like to take it back to Kugane. On the off chance it is sentient, we must hope it sees fit to forgive my earlier misgivings.
Our risks thus far have paid fine dividends, and I have you to thank for it. You have my utmost gratitude, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>.
You have done well to forestall your fate... But your end is come!
The chorus of steel rings eternal!
Mark where the armor readies its blade─though it has quite a reach, it cannot strike everywhere at once!
Could this be an accursed treasure, I wonder? That blade in the box we encountered was rather suspicious as well...
A sorry attempt at an ambush, if you ask me...but let us continue on.
Arrive on the landfast floe
Clear the landfast floe
Arrive in Cyancap Cavern
Clear Cyancap Cavern
Arrive in the Deep Below
Defeat the Octomammoth
If you would oppose our crusade, then come!
But know that none shall deny us salvation.
I will free us from the wheel!
I will suffer no obstacles!
You wretch!
Such is your power?
No matter the foe, I will stay the course...
Look to the heavens for your doom!
Ware my rime-kissed blades!
A raging gale to rend you asunder!
This place shall be your tomb!
Let lightning surge!
Come forth, my servant of shadow!
Dragon! Hear me and obey!
With abyssal dark and hero's blade, I bring my people liberation!
You shall know true terror!
Crush them!
Begone!
Bathe them in black flame!
Render unto me your all!
My meteors will extinguish your Light!
Our salvation is at hand!
I am Asura, and on battle I thrive.
Have you the courage and strength to face me?
Will you dodge or will you bleed?
You've not time to blink!
Tremble before the might of the Manusya!
Come forth, embodiment of carnage!
Revel on the bloody field of war!
The spirit of battle awakens!
Behold the sixfold blade!
The face of battle is ever changing...
The frail shall fall!
The weak shall perish!
Show me your steel!
I am unrelenting!
I will scatter your bones!
Defeat Athena
Show me your all, that I might become divinity manifest!
From nothing, I mold life!
These chains are forged from the fabric of creation!
To silent vessels, I give voice!
This is but a glimpse of a god's strength!
Behold such power as you will never wield!
From the deepest pit of the seven hells to the pinnacle of the heavens, the world shall tremble!
Such a singularly resolute soul...
You cannot escape my eternal gaze.
Shine brilliant for me!
Today, my theories shall be proven as fact!
Miscalculations are inevitable...but vexing.
What arrogance to defy a god!
Could my theories have been flawed...?
Although I wished so ardently...
But perhaps...with the Heart of Sabik!
Yes... The flaws are not mine...
This misbegotten world is to blame...
Only the hands of a god can fix it─my hands!
I can create worlds─or unmake them!
Only I can guide this star to its rightful place!
The heavens bend to my will!
Denizens of the abyss! From ink of blackest night, I summon you!
Misfortune hangs heavy on the prideful. Poor cover for when the heavens fall.
From base elements is greatness forged!
The wheel of life turns by my hand!
The elements flow according to my design.
Creation's course is mine to set!
A god's will cannot be disobeyed!
This world must be made anew!
I will not be denied!
Why do you suffer this pathetic existence!?
I...I am infallible...
Why...does this world persist?
Why...do I persist?
